newsitem.title: USA: Lindsay sees FY97 revenue growth over goal.
newsitem.headline: Lindsay sees FY97 revenue growth over goal.

text.p: Lindsay Manufacturing Co said Tuesday it is confident it will beat its goal of revenue growth of five to 10 percent in fiscal 1997, and may post gains of 15 to 20 percent.

"We continue to feel confident in our ability to exceed Lindsay's top-line growth goal of five to 10 percent for the year," Gary Parker, chairman, president and chief executive, said in a statement. "Based on promising market conditions, as well as our strong first and second quarters, we believe that we should see full-year revenue gains in the range of 15 to 20 percent," he said.
Earlier, Lindsay reported earnings for its second fiscal quarter ended February 28 of $0.61 a share versus $0.52. Revenues rose to $45.69 million from $38.14 million.
Lindsay, which provides irrigation equipment, said its market conditions remain favorable, as above-average commodity prices continue to strengthen U.S. farms.
At February 28, Lindsay's order backlog was $31.6 million, up 16 percent from the $27.3 million posted last year.
The company said it will continue to use share repurchase plans, stock splits and dividends to further enhance shareholder value.
